They can be combined with other techniques: â€“Str Use method String.FromCharCode() â€“Une Use Unescape() function â€“Mix Mix String.FromCharCode() and Unescape() â€“Dec Use Decimal encoding â€“Hex Use Hexadecimal encoding â€“Hes Use Hexadecimal encoding with semicolons â€“Dwo Encode IP addresses with DWORD â€“Doo Encode IP addresses with Octal â€“Cem=CEM Set different â€˜Character Encoding Mutationsâ€™1234567891011å¤ç”¨ç¼–ç (reversing obfuscators) (ex: â€˜Mix,Une,Str,Hexâ€™)Options: â€“version show programâ€˜s version number and exit -h, â€“help show this help message and exit -s, â€“statistics show advanced statistics output results -v, â€“verbose active verbose mode output results â€“gtk launch XSSer GTK Interface â€“wizard start Wizard Helper! Special Features: You can set Vector(s) and Bypasser(s) to build complex scripts for XSS code embedded. XST allows you to discover if target is vulnerable to â€˜Cross Site Tracingâ€˜ [CAPEC-107]: â€“imx=IMX IMX - Create an image with XSS (â€“imx image.png) â€“fla=FLASH FLA - Create a flash movie with XSS (â€“fla movie.swf) â€“xst=XST XST - Cross Site Tracing (â€“xst http(s)://host.com) Select Target(s): At least one of these options must to be specified to set the source to get target(s) urls from: â€“all=TARGET Automatically audit an entire target -u URL, â€“url=URL Enter target to audit -i READFILE Read target(s) urls from file -d DORK Search target(s) using a query (ex: â€˜news.php?id=â€˜) -l Search from a list of â€˜dorksâ€˜ â€“De=DORK_ENGINE Use this search engine (default: duck) â€“Da Search massively using all search engines Select type of HTTP/HTTPS Connection(s): These options can be used to specify which parameter(s) we want to use as payload(s) to inject: -g GETDATA Send payload using GET (ex: â€˜/menu.php?q=â€˜) -p POSTDATA Send payload using POST (ex: â€˜foo=1&bar=â€˜) -c CRAWLING Number of urls to crawl on target(s): 1-99999 â€“Cw=CRAWLER_WIDTH Deeping level of crawler: 1-5 (default 3) â€“Cl Crawl only local target(s) urls (default TRUE) Configure Request(s): These options can be used to specify how to connect to the target(s) payload(s). You can choose multiple: â€“cookie=COOKIE Change your HTTP Cookie header â€“drop-cookie Ignore Set-Cookie header from response â€“user-agent=AGENT Change your HTTP User-Agent header (default SPOOFED) â€“referer=REFERER Use another HTTP Referer header (default NONE) â€“xforw Set your HTTP X-Forwarded-For with random IP values â€“xclient Set your HTTP X-Client-IP with random IP values â€“headers=HEADERS Extra HTTP headers newline separated â€“auth-type=ATYPE HTTP Authentication type (Basic, Digest, GSS or NTLM) â€“auth-cred=ACRED HTTP Authentication credentials (name:password) â€“proxy=PROXY Use proxy server (tor: http://localhost:8118) â€“ignore-proxy Ignore system default HTTP proxy â€“timeout=TIMEOUT Select your timeout (default 30) â€“retries=RETRIES Retries when the connection timeouts (default 1) â€“threads=THREADS Maximum number of concurrent HTTP requests (default 5) â€“delay=DELAY Delay in seconds between each HTTP request (default 0) â€“tcp-nodelay Use the TCP_NODELAY option â€“follow-redirects Follow server redirection responses (302) â€“follow-limit=FLI Set limit for redirection requests (default 50) Checker Systems: These options are useful to know if your target is using filters against XSS attacks: â€“hash send a hash to check if target is repeating content â€“heuristic discover parameters filtered by using heuristics â€“discode=DISCODE set code on reply to discard an injection â€“checkaturl=ALT check reply using: alternative url -> Blind XSS â€“checkmethod=ALTM check reply using: GET or POST (default: GET) â€“checkatdata=ALD check reply using: alternative payload â€“reverse-check establish a reverse connection from target to XSSer to certify that is 100% vulnerable (recommended!) Select Vector(s): These options can be used to specify injection(s) code. Important if you donâ€™t want to inject a common XSS vector used by default. Choose only one option: â€“payload=SCRIPT OWN - Inject your own code â€“auto AUTO - Inject a list of vectors provided by XSSer Anti-antiXSS Firewall rules: These options can be used to try to bypass specific WAF/IDS products. Choose only if required: â€“Phpids0.6.5 PHPIDS (0.6.5) [ALL] â€“Phpids0.7 PHPIDS (0.7) [ALL] â€“Imperva Imperva Incapsula [ALL] â€“Webknight WebKnight (4.1) [Chrome] â€“F5bigip F5 Big IP [Chrome + FF + Opera] â€“Barracuda Barracuda WAF [ALL] â€“Modsec Mod-Security [ALL] â€“Quickdefense QuickDefense [Chrome] Select Bypasser(s): These options can be used to encode vector(s) and try to bypass possible anti-XSS filters. They can be combined with other techniques: â€“Str Use method String.FromCharCode() â€“Une Use Unescape() function â€“Mix Mix String.FromCharCode() and Unescape() â€“Dec Use Decimal encoding â€“Hex Use Hexadecimal encoding â€“Hes Use Hexadecimal encoding with semicolons â€“Dwo Encode IP addresses with DWORD â€“Doo Encode IP addresses with Octal â€“Cem=CEM Set different â€˜Character Encoding Mutationsâ€™ (reversing obfuscators) (ex: â€˜Mix,Une,Str,Hexâ€™) Special Technique(s): These options can be used to inject code using different XSS techniques. You can choose multiple: â€“Coo COO - Cross Site Scripting Cookie injection â€“Xsa XSA - Cross Site Agent Scripting â€“Xsr XSR - Cross Site Referer Scripting â€“Dcp DCP - Data Control Protocol injections â€“Dom DOM - Document Object Model injections â€“Ind IND - HTTP Response Splitting Induced code â€“Anchor ANC - Use Anchor Stealth payloader (DOM shadows!) Select Final injection(s): These options can be used to specify the final code to inject on vulnerable target(s). Important if you want to exploit â€˜on-the-wildâ€™ the vulnerabilities found. Choose only one option: â€“Fp=FINALPAYLOAD OWN - Exploit your own code â€“Fr=FINALREMOTE REMOTE - Exploit a script -remotely- â€“Doss DOSs - XSS (server) Denial of Service â€“Dos DOS - XSS (client) Denial of Service â€“B64 B64 - Base64 code encoding in META tag (rfc2397) Special Final injection(s): These options can be used to execute some â€˜specialâ€™ injection(s) on vulnerable target(s).
